metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1321 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the file picker implementation in Oxide before 1.6.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted webpage.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1321` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
